SHIP: ^You wake up from a deep sleep that isn’t a sleep as much as a not there. Your head feels like it is full of fluid. Your head isn’t — filled with fluid — but your mouth and nose are. You gag.

c-0: ^ [REDACTED] CORP. says that it has notes of citrus and vanilla. You find no comfort in these flavor notes as you spew goopy liquid from your mouth and nose. [REDACTED] CORP.? You might be asking. You may struggle to remember what a CORP. even is. Or who You even is. That’s okay. That is probably normal. These sorts of things tend to happen coming out of cryo-sleep.  Everything is okay. Probably.

^ All that being said, we need to run a few tests. Just to make sure there wasn’t any brain damage. From the prolonged stasis. You understand. You filled out the health and safety waivers like all the other precocious little space explorers. Adventures aren’t really adventures without danger or potential brain damage, after all.

^Just a few psychological measurements. Quick and painless. Just like a shot, minus the needle. Or the burning fluid. I kid. I kid. We have fun here, on the ship. You and I. [REDACTED] CORP. shelled out for my humor firmware update.

g-0: ^AI: Your handy definitely-a-holograph examiner will now administer a series of tests. No need to be alarmed. Please immediately stop playing the game now and turn to said examiner for further assistance.

c-0: ^AI: Alright! That wasn't so bad, was it? I bet you didn't even notice the copious amounts of blood being drawn.

b: ^ You’re probably a bit foggy still. So first, some house cleaning. That is, I’m sure you have questions. And I, have answers. Probably.

crash: ^Probable Question 1: Who are you, mysterious voice?

c-0: ^I, am you AI companion. I was designed to keep you company. Previous explorers, lacking such illustrious companions, had a tendency to go pants-on-head mad. It is in the [REDACTED] CORP.’s best interest if you do not take up fecal matter finger painting or consume your own feet.

^You — as you may have guessed — are in space. We have just exited near lightspeed. question: ^Oh, by the way. No big deal. ALERT ALERT. Ignore that, just thinking out loud. But soon-ish, if you’re up for it, you should definitely strap yourself in. The exogenous carapace — exopace, if you will — is currently, well, not melting per se. More like, you know how if you take a cold — say — bowl. A cold ceramic bowl, and you put something very hot into it and it just sort of cracks and falls apart? Yeah. It’s doing that. Don’t worry, my little space explorer. We’ll be perfectly fine as long as the endogenous carapace doesn’t — oh — okay, it just melted. Melted proper, no ceramic bowl stuff.

c-0: ^Ah. Good choice. Brave is a synonym of audacious. Which is a synonym of foolhardy. Which is bad, after all. You are certainly no fool. Nor hardy. Why be a lion, when you can be an, er, pillbug.
c-1: ^Ah. Good show. Keen and clever effort, I dare say. There’s the slight problem of you launching the escape pod before climbing inside. But that’s really a secondary, or even tertiary addendum to how keen and clever you are for pressing that button. Real shame, not being inside the pod though.
